Reviews.Title: Fraudulent Seller, Beware!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Francis
Reviews.Content: This one star is not for the Laptop but for the third party seller on Amazon. The laptop I would give two starts because it developed horizontal lines across the top of the screen and one star for the seller for selling a used Laptop as new. I found out that the laptop was used, when I tried to have Dell do a service call, to repair the display. After giving them the Service Tag # and my name, they informed me that it was owned by someone previously. I told them, "that can't be", I bought it from Amazon brand new, at least that's what I thought. They assured me that it was in fact, a used Laptop. This seller should be band from doing business on Amazon, for pulling a stunt like this. I would strongly advise anyone who have bought anything from this seller to check it out with the manufacture, to see if it was registered previously. If this Laptop hadn't developed a problem, it may never came to light, that I had bought a used laptop.Update:This laptop has really turned out to be a nightmare purchase. After returning the used laptop sold as new, Amazon is now refusing to give me a full refund, charging me $329.8 restocking fee for the used and faulty laptop, I guess to resell it as  new again. I don't know where they find these geniuses they hire as Customer support reps. The rep told me I should have returned it within thirty days, this is after I told him that the laptop developed the lines about a week and a half ago, which is months after it was purchased. I asked him, so why would I return a perfectly good working laptop if nothing is wrong with it, the problem developed after that magic window and Dell refused to fix it because they say, I am not the owner because it is registered to someone else. I spoke to rep who called himself David M. who refused to give me his last name, all he did was, keep repeating this 30 days, 30 days, like a scratched record. It was like speaking to a piece of log, he could not understand, the part about the fact that Dell said the Service Tag attached to that Laptop was registered to someone else in effect, making it a used laptop. I mean, all the knuckle head had to do, was to call up Dell and give them the Service Tag # to confirm what I am saying. He could not do that because he was too busy, accusing me of lying, when it is so easy to verify the facts.  I will pursue all available avenues, to get my money back. It is plain and simply wrong to sell a used item as new.Update:/ 4/11/14After filing a complaint with the BBB Amazon has reviewed my case and found out that the Laptop was in fact, registered to someone else, making it not new but used. They have decided to issue a full refund. They need to reprimand that Amazon employee, that try to insinuate that I was lying. All he had to do was to call Dell with the Service Tag # and it would have been cleared up in an instant. Instead, he convinced himself, that I was lying and just wanted to change the laptop after a long use. Shame on you David M. Whomever you are, if that's even your real name. Thanks to Amazon for making this right.

Reviews.Title: Wifi didn't work from the first moment I got it. Dell are still working on getting me a replacement 4 months later
Reviews.Author: amichay oren
Reviews.Content: Dell discontinued this model for a very good reason. I have an old XPS15 which is a wonderful computer, and wanted an upgrade. This model has serious KNOWN design flaws in the Wifi antenna. Usually these can be solved by replacing the LCD, but in my case it didn't work. Since Dell no longer produce this model, the have now promised to send me an upgrade. Hopefully, the new model will not have the same problems.If you don't need Wifi, or you're sitting right next to the router AND your main need is I/O, then this computer is actually a pretty good choice. The keyboard is extremely comfortable, the processor is not the strongest i7-3 out there, but it's pretty good, especially with parallel processing, and the SSD drive is obviously the best you can get for heavy I/O. Windows 8 is a pain, but what can you do? All the new drivers are designed for this OS, so no point in trying to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: workhorse
Reviews.Author: Michael Ng
Reviews.Content: I would give it a 4.5 star but half stars aren't an option. Performance is great. Its such a workhorse. I'm a photographer and high end retoucher and it performs on the level the high end Macbook pros. Why didn't I just get a macbook instead? I like PC gaming and this handles it pretty darn well as a gaming machine for LANning with friends. I also plan on video editing so we'll see how that performs. I took half a star off because there seems to be very slight bubbling on the very bottom of the screen that I noticed right as soon as I took it out the box.  It doesn't interfere with the performance or display. Its practically unnoticeable but it is there on my particular one. I can't say this will be a consistent issue for every single one of this model but it is on mine. Other than that I love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Major flaw in-design
Reviews.Author: joel mamedov
Reviews.Content: The keyboard is terrible and useless.But, here is a big one.Purchased a brand new. Did not use every day.After 20 days hard driver failed. Lost all my files.During the use I noticed this laptop heats up quickly and not cooling down at all.I was just browsing the web nothing heavy. Anyway, I strongly believe this laptop has a major design problem and not tested well. Has problem with cooling system and the way internal components jammed tougher to make it light and small. On top of that you will have to deal with Dell’s outsourced garbage service.

Reviews.Title: product went defect after 4 months, so far nobody can help wit the warranty
Reviews.Author: toon overstijns
Reviews.Content: This means I loose the product without any return, replacement . Screen went flickerring and so cant use this laptop anymore. Dell cant repare since its supplied by someone else... very poor product and even worse service.I await help from the seller now...

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Richard Y.
Reviews.Content: This laptop is what I expected it to be: a powerplant! I read numerous reviews about it. Unfortunately I had a problem with the mousepad and blueray drive not working but dell got that working. They sent someone to my house to replace the blueray drive and fixed the trackpad over the chatline so I am not disappointed with the machine at all. Very powerful, nice screen, and thin. Not as thin as the ultrabooks we see today because of the optical drive but it's all good.

Reviews.Title: Fully as expected
Reviews.Author: Kolbrun Kjartansdottir
Reviews.Content: Great computer to a reasonable price.This is a laptop for people that need power, put are not too concerned about the weight.

Reviews.Title: It is not so good but service is good
Reviews.Author: Zhou Min
Reviews.Content: It works very fast in the first, but it can not work any more after a month and I don't know what is wrong whit the item. So I return it.it is heavy.but amazon's service is good.
